alert.note: Alert for Shackelford; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 5:32PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Shackelford and Throckmorton Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222 to 7 miles southwest of Fort Griffin. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Throckmorton, Woodson, Elbert, Millers Creek Reservoir, Fort Griffin, The Intersection Of Us-183 And Us-283, Us-183 Near The Throckmorton- Baylor County Line, Lusk, The Intersection Of Us- 380 And Highway 222 and The Intersection Of Us- 283 And Ranch Road 209. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Texas.
